messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] France
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks this was helpful and along the same lines I found researching online. We will be there less than two years. I don t want to have to test at all! All my
messages.messageBody:
Thanks this was helpful and along the same lines I found researching online. We will be there less than two years. I don't want to have to test at all!

All my best--Kelli
Sent from my iFriend

On Aug 12, 2009, at 10:42 AM, Vanessa Jubis <vjubis@...> wrote:

Info I got from another group. See below:

Vanessa:

My sister lives in France and my understanding is that Homeschool laws are
similar to what we have in FL-- you register your intent to Homeschool and
then have yearly evaluations or tests. This organization is the big
homeschool group, she should contact them with any questions:
http://www.lesenfantsdabord.org/index.php .

As for vaccinations--I'm not sure what the laws are, but I do know that
France's healthcare system allows for alternative health providers. My
sister was seeing a homeopath who advised her to stop vaccinating her kids.
She ended up still vaccinating but selectively and on an extended schedule.
But if the homeopath was advising it, I have to assume there's a legal way
to avoid vax.

The next time I speak to my sis, I will ask for more info on that!

On Wed, Aug 12, 2009 at 9:08 AM, Kelli Johnston <kaipelesmom@...>wrote:

>
>
> Hi, we are considering a move to Paris that will probably last for two
> years. I am concerned about homeschooling laws and vaccination requirements
> there. I was hoping someone could either point me in the right direction or
> give me personal advice because of personal experience. Thanks so much. (we
> are unschoolers an my kids are 5 and 7)
> -Kelli
>
>
>

--
Vanessa Jubis

messages.subject: France
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, we are considering a move to Paris that will probably last for two years. I am concerned about homeschooling laws and vaccination requirements there. I was
messages.messageBody:
Hi, we are considering a move to Paris that will probably last for two years. I am concerned about homeschooling laws and vaccination requirements there. I was hoping someone could either point me in the right direction or give me personal advice because of personal experience. Thanks so much. (we are unschoolers an my kids are 5 and 7)
-Kelli
